etymology.description: 田(田) (tián, "field") + 匀(勻) (yún, "even") = even field
etymology.interpretation: The character 畇(yún, "even field") uses the semantic component 田(田) (tián, "field") to signify agriculture or farmland, paired with the phonetic component 匀(匀) (yún, "even") to express the idea of a field with even or level terrain, essential for effective planting and farming.

examples.chinese: 农田的畇均匀地分布着细小的庄稼(農田的畇均勻地分布著細小的莊稼)。
examples.pinyin: nóngtián de yún jūnyún dì fēnbù zhe xìxiǎo de zhuāngjià.
examples.english: The even fields in the farmland are neatly distributed with small crops.

examples.chinese: 春风拂过田野(春風拂過田野)，带动着平整的畇闪出银光(帶動著平整的畇閃出銀光)。
examples.pinyin: chūnfēng fúguò tiányě, dàidòng zhe píngzhěng de yún shǎnchū yínguāng.
examples.english: The spring breeze sweeps across the fields, causing the even fields to shine with a silvery glow.
